body:
Thanks for the response. For reference, I used numpy's rollaxis as follows:

`ex_img = numpy.rollaxis(ex_img, axis=2, start=0)`

This managed to get the network training!
I recently had the same issue: https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/issues/3123
That's wierd. I've updated the NNVM.
I think you need a new model and bind all the trianed params into it.
I think you can use mx.nd.crop for this
i need to copy into pre allocated ndarrays and avoid making extra copies of memory. for data par, the targets are all pre allocated.
crop(ou=target) should do it
hmm, this should do the trick. I missed this one. Thanks!
@tornadomeet how many k80 are you using? i tested the performance on both m40 and k80, `local` should keep the same performance.

@mli  i have test 1 k80 and 3 k80 last week, use resnet-50, the speed of kv-store=local of this pr is only (<) 70% of this:https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/commit/73a0f6eb7f5570c3a8aa93f9e1fa6bf257a7bdd8

@tornadomeet can you double check? the pr should be the same performance as the current master for kvstore=local. i rechecked on resnet-50. while the major difference comparing to 73a0f6e is due to #3238, and the current master should be faster. at least it is true on my machine.
@mli  ok, i'll test the current master this afternoon~

@mli  hello,
 i just test the current master, this pr is almost **the same** with current master when kv-store=local.

4gpu, resent-50:

a little better, but not good as my installed version.  
i'm confused about which version i installed at that time! i test some version near 2016.08.13, but it the same  as above, i.e. better than currently master, but worse than my installed vesion.

@mli @tqchen @piiswrong   i think we can merge this pr now.
and i'll deep check what's wrong if  needed (when my gpu is idle:))

I write my code according to the indication of #3123, but I am not sure whether it is correct.

model_args = {}
assert save_model_prefix is not None
model = mx.model.FeedForward.load(load_model_prefix, load_epoch)

internals = model.symbol.get_internals()
print internals.list_outputs()

dr7_symbol = internals["drop7_output"]

#below is the layer I add
fc8 = mx.symbol.FullyConnected(data=dr7_symbol, num_hidden=256)

fc9 = mx.symbol.FullyConnected(data=fc8, num_hidden=12000)

bn9 = mx.symbol.BatchNorm(data=fc9)

softmax = mx.symbol.SoftmaxOutput(data=bn9, name='softmax')

feature_extractor = mx.model.FeedForward(ctx=mx.gpu(), symbol=softmax,
                                         arg_params=model.arg_params,
                                         aux_params=model.aux_params,
                                         allow_extra_params=True)
By the way I also need to initialize the weights and bias of fc8 before use them

@sxjscience: this looks good to me. Lets merge it, as its fixing an obvious problem. 

We should involve others in the design of this symbol. There are pros and cons for all options.
@sbodenstein I agree. How about opening a discussing issue?
@tqchen @piiswrong need help.

In additional tests, I set the training epochs low so I could try a test prediction before saving, and got some different behaviour.

```
a = model.predict(exemplars_train[0:1])
print a
```

> [[ nan  nan  nan  nan  nan  nan  nan  nan  nan]]

I presume then that something has gone wrong with the training, if everything is coming out as NaNs.
LGTM, BTW @tornadomeet can you do a bit test on gradients of use_global_stats? There has been change in BN recently and I want to confirm that it works
there is a bug in gradient node checking that is fixed by https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/3278, let us wait and see if that can be merged in, close this for now
merged via https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/3290
@yajiedesign any updated comments on this?
@tqchen no
@tqchen  ok, i'll test it today.

You mentioned that some flags need to be set true. One way to resolve that is that we avoid compilation of nnvm library via the cmake subproject but simply include nnvm compilation rules in cmake of mxnet, will that resolve the problem?
please rebase against the recent nnvm(or start as a clean fork) as there is a force push to bring in master status
I have the same problem with @anthony-han  , @hjk41 and i use both  pre-compiled libmxnet.dll and  compiled it on my own,the problem is still there.
@tqchen  yes, there is a small bug in bias gradient when `use_global_stats=True`, and i fixed it, then test_operator.py should pass, or it will fail.
We have switched scala version to 2.11.8 recently (in order to support macro). Also you can use `scala-package/dev/change-scala-version.sh` to change the scala version easily.

Thanks. I suppose that I can build it myself then.
On Maven Central the only version listed there is still 2.10.
It'd be good if mxnet for Scala 2.11 is pushed to Maven Central.

@jermainewang I changed the setuptools back to distutil, because although the setuptool enables correct installation, the build --inplace did not copy the .so file of corresponding module correctly back to the python/mxnet/_cy2 folder, so the PYTHONPATH way does not work
We're still working on some new features, will push it soon.
@piiswrong  i just saw it.  i'll check it next week. (3 holiday days and i have no computer at home:) )
`rollaxis` is ok, but the more straight forward way is `ex_img.transpose(2, 0, 1)`
I used the way you said. directly contains the source into the mxnet source tree.it work fine.
@tqchen ok i am rebase
I finally find how to save them, close it

recently I  changed the batch size to 16 , it works fine!

thanks :-)
@bonsairobo  you can try gcc-5.4 to do this

After running the test over and over, occasionally I get values such as:

> [[ 0.02064759  0.06183811  0.00453668  0.16070589  0.04567864  0.55165589 0.03681038  0.0664523   0.05167448 ]]

but mostly I just get the NaNs. The only times this happens is when I print the arg_params from the FeedForward model before predicting (but not always).
great, thanks a lot for the effort!

The customized python operator was not supported, but the c++ operator can be supported as long as you include these files in the amalgamation file list here https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/amalgamation/mxnet_predict0.cc#L49
need rebase against master
This is a problem of NVCC not MXNet, please note that CUDA7.5 does not support gcc-5 and you can do CUDA8.0rc which comes with a patch for gcc-5
The new updates is now merged in
This was because you did not build mxnet, please follow the instruction to build mxnet first before doing installation
@sxjscience Do you might do a bit weight lifting here?
closing due to long time inactive
@tqchen  thanks any way,  i solved this issue with using gcc-5.4.0 to build mxnet. gcc-4.9.3 didn't work.
hm the variable is not picked up by `dmlc-core` and I have to do `make USE_SSE=0`
@piiswrong
Your cuda sdk isn't installed properly. Set USE_CUDA=0 in config.mk
depends on https://github.com/dmlc/mshadow/pull/166, but should then be good to go.

A couple suggestions:
1. Add a compiler flag USE_PROFILER
2. wrap profiler message in macro that returns nullptr when USE_PROFILER=false
3. use macro stringification to include more detail like op name in message

(n,c_h_w) can be useful for attention.
Although (n, c, h_w) also works. So i guess we can use (n, c, h_w) if you don't want one more mode
Could you submit to dmlc:nnvm after this https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/3301 is merged
import logging and set logging level to debug
@tqchen  Yes, I can do that. 'm busy with deadlines these days so I may be slow for that....
updates?

1. Ribbon 1 The idea of a continuous shape to form the logo I think communicates the concept of flexilbity well, and is conceptually similar to related competitors in the space. This gives us a logo mark that can be used alone for the “MX” or with the logotype below combined.
1. Ribbon 2 Same idea as above, but slightly different design.
1. MX polygon Abstracted shape of “M” and “X” that is intended to look like a butterfly/crystal shape. It has some three dimensionality depending on the colors we use.
1. Continuous line A single line forming MX, with a partial infinity loop at the end

Let't use github's new thumb up feature.

BTW, I like green better :)
Torch: blue, TF: yellow/orange, Caffe: Red
we get to call dibs on green
Everything is available in green. Vote this post if you like blue.
Vote this post if you like green
Please feel free to submit any other logo candidates.
The blue one is actually a little different from the green one. I like the blue one's shape better. M should be a little smaller and X should be bigger.
@piiswrong ok.

HI @jonasrla 
I think cnn + svm classifier is very useful  and I am very interesting in it.
Is there a plan for GPU version?
this is now ready.
@piiswrong it can be solved with setting USE_CUDA=0  and gcc-5.4.0. but with gcc-4.9, it didn't work either.
`MX polygon` is definitely the best one.
logging and visualization is something we should have. I don't know about Kibana+Logstash though. Seems like pretty heavy machinery with a log of dependencies. Is it really necessary?
The first one is concise and easy to recognize.
I prefer blue than green for software icon.

@yajiedesign I find that you introduced the library dependency during build. Currently in linux the cython dll files are build without linking to libmxnet, but the system will load libmxnet first globally in startup and then these symbols are found during importation time.

Please let me know if things need to be different on windows

@tqchen yes, msvc must link it when build.i am pr https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/3309
And want to pay attention,msvc use LLP64 ,so  "long long" is 64bit ,"long" is 32bit.
Yes, you are right……They are much bigger than I thought(It needs about 150MB, most part may be the jvm in docker......). I'll keep on finding appropriate tools to do so.
However I would say logging and visualization are kind of independent. Maybe we could start from logging first.
mx.callback.do_checkpoint(xxx, N epoch)
yes. We can even consider using tensorflow's logging format and try to strip tensorboard out of tensorflow

FYI, now NNPACK supports Android.
See mask in softmax_output

Thanks for the quick response. I searched the github repo for softmax_output, and don't see mask relating to it at all. I searched for softmax_output and mask and didn't get anything. Can you point me more specifically to what you mean? It's a bit vague.

https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/src/operator/softmax_output-inl.h#L32
This only applies to multi_output softmax now, but it shouldn't be too hard to modify it to support single output

@xmchen1987 You are more than welcomed to propose a PR for the BatchNorm. Normally, the omp won't provide much improvement over simple elementwise ops. We can enable some of them manually in the performance critical ops by hand crafting some of the loops
how to fix it?
@wushouchuan thanks I will try
